title: Good opportunity
pros: Given resources to succeed here.
cons: industry has yet to go through tech innovation, lots of unknown. not many cons with company

title: Not what they used to be
pros: Remote work, ability to earn $$$$
cons: Turn times are not the best, cost of benefits and options

title: Work is hard but pay is solid.
pros: The pay and benefits are decent.
cons: Manual underwriter to AMOS guidelines is very different from Conventional.

title: Its a job
pros: Very Busy, no shortage on deals to look at. Rates are higher then other lenders for conventional loans, makes them tough to land. They have great NON QM mortgages, but with the rate hikes, market has slowed to crawl.
cons: Hired too many people. Success rate diminished as more people brought on, not enough good leads to go around.

pros: None. Wait, the building is nice and in a nice area.
cons: This company doesn't care about its employees, AT ALL. However if you like free lunches over sustainable compensation, or the billionaire owners come to the company to visit tell you the company is in great financial condition and don't worry about your jobs to then lay off over 50% of the company a week later w/ no notice or severance package then this is the company for you!

title: Things Could Have Been Better!
pros: They take a chance on those with no mortgage background. Everyone is very helpful when they can be. Some departments had the flexibility to work from home. It was typically very easy to take time off when you needed it.
cons: Hard to get promoted. There's a lack of transparency with what is going on with the company behind closed doors. it's hard to get promoted, especially if your are good in your roll. Can be extremely over-worked. HR isn't very helpful when it comes to employee concerns. There aren't any people of color in Executive Level Management, actually there wasn't but a couple of POC in management at all. There's no diversity & inclusion team, no team building - many of us worked in the office together but had no idea who one-another was as me only sat in one section over from one another.

title: Perpetually Toxic Environment
pros: Some employees (Mostly sales) gets bonuses.
cons: A perpetually toxic work environment with constant back stabbing and finger pointing between teams. Management is oblivious to this festering culture and in some areas contribute to its continuation. There is no upward mobility in the company. Most of the time you will just be moved into an equal paying job with no bonus structure and they will call it a promotion. CEO only cares about his sales reps. Every other member of the company could leave and be replaced (Which he has made happen before) and he would never notice anyone was missing.

title: This Company Laid-Off Staff w/No Notice - Employees were Blindsided
pros: The leadership provided lunch for employees on the last 2-business days of the month.
cons: Angel Oak Mortgage Solutions laid-off most of it's workforce in Atlanta on March 24, 2020, in the middle of the Coronavirus COVD-19 global pandemic, with no advanced notice given to employees. Employees were told that they would only be paid through that day, March 24, 2020. I was completely blind-sided by the insensitivity and lack of concern for employees and their families by the Angel Oak leadership team.

title: Very disorganized organization but good experience
pros: Got good experience in manual /Non QM underwriting (valued when going to other positions) Lunch paid for twice a month Was lucky I had a great manager
cons: Where to start lol - can be very stressful. Loans are complicated and can take hours to underwrite. I am lucky I an a naturally fast learner and can teach myself because they kind of throw you to the wolves and it is not the easiest learning how to manually do everything and with their system High stress enviornment - conditions could take as long as a new loan. You were constantly swamped when it was busy. Also if you had a bad underwriting assistant then you work could double. Luckily i had great ones The AEs are brutal and most of them are cutthroat. Wont accept a no for an answer and will go over you to get a yes. The annoying part is - sometimes management caved to them and you would be put in uncomfortable position of approving something you would not sign your name to Hours could be long and even when you take time off you could almost not enjoy it because leading up to it you had to make sure all your loans were mostly taken care of - otherwise people would moan and whine about it when you came back. Also when i said that i liked to leave work for hour lunch ppl laughed and said you’ll quickly leanr you cant here. They were right - after training - i never left the office for lunch during my entire time there. I had lunch at my desk because it was the only way to finish your work Benefits were not great compared to what you had to pay and pto was nothing special either

title: Lack Credible Training
pros: 6 Month Ramp Up Allowance.
cons: - Subpar new hire training, - - told to figure out things out on your own - no sales training resources to refer back to - hostile work environment- sales managers & colleagues team up to intercept deals behind your back taking them for themselves instead of supporting/training the new AE's. - No regional team meetings, ever, further alienating employees.

title: Solid company
pros: Competitive pay given the position and the industry. Good benefits package including medical, dental and 401K.
cons: Extremely rigid guidelines with seemingly arbitrary loan decisions made at the elevated levels.

title: Can be very stressful
pros: At the time bonus was good and can get experience with Non QM
cons: Stressful, long hours, and svp doesnt give a crap about their underwriters or underwriter assistants

title: Okay
pros: Pros: Good commitment to technology, competitive product pricing, strong senior management, and good capital backing.
cons: Cons: Subpar middle management, minimal teamwork far outweighed by cattiness and backstabbing, very weak cooperation between sales and operations.

title: Great Company to work for
pros: Excellent leadership, great potential, amazing support team
cons: it takes work to really get going, if you think you can sit back and just send emails, you'll never make it

title: Lots of work and little pay
pros: free lunch at the end of the month
cons: Loooooots of work a very little compensation. Our company makes 100s of millions of dollars and doesn't invest it into their employees. We are understaffed, overworked, and underpaid. There is also no real mobility in the company. you either move to another department with no tiers or leave. Not a great place to grow and progress.

title: Over Promise Under Deliver
pros: Experience in the Non QM space.
cons: Always saying things will get better but never really get to that point. They were always hyping up what was to come but ultimately laid off a lot of people.

title: Angel Oak MS
pros: Good Company, had worked with all but one of the Regional Managers at a former company
cons: 72% of the employees was laid off due to COVID-19

title: Review
pros: Great product line, a lot of communication, freedom to run your business and make the money you want to make.
cons: Training should be more ongoing and sharing of best practices

title: Amazing
pros: Highly recommend for anyone looking to grow and learn about the mortgage industry.
cons: No cons, this place is amazing! And great pay!

title: Wasn't the best but wasn't the worst
pros: Work from home if needed, get your work done correctly no one bothers you
cons: Low pay and still was having growing pains

title: Great work life balance
pros: Work life balance, compensation was decent, team was friendly.
cons: Not a lot of growth opportunities in certain roles and benefits were sub par.

title: Poor Salary and awful management
pros: No great pros, worse environment I've ever worked in.
cons: Pick and choose who they give bonuses to, make you do the work they don't want to give to their favorite employees, hostile work environment, tons of gossip and awful people.

title: Great manager
pros: Great moral.... Management is very supportive
cons: Under paid... The hourly/ annual pay does not match the work load.

title: Love it here
pros: Super nice team and love the brokers. Plenty of OT.
cons: I really can’t think of anything.

title: Loved working here
pros: family oriented, great management, reasonable pay.
cons: Business was slow so there were lots of lay offs

title: Angel Oak MS
pros: Great leadership and teamwork with management and co-workers.
cons: Need more hands on training. Work Long Hours.

title: Must be determined
pros: Good people and mortgage process.
cons: It takes a long time to get ramped up

title: Angel oak is awesome
pros: great atmosphere, love my co workers
cons: office is far from my house.

title: Great Company to work for
pros: Great Leadership, compensation, operations support
cons: subject to secondary market volatility

title: Love what you do
pros: Compensated for work done is good.
cons: unclear and inconsistent operating standards

title: Daily Shark Tank Setting
pros: Good local branch office culture
cons: Shark tank like HQ and Management

title: Love It
pros: Great mangers and free lunches
cons: Benefits could be better and pto

title: Horrible
pros: Really there is nothing to see here.
cons: This company is the worst!
